alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 4:33PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, Chesterfield, City of Richmond, Hanover and Henrico. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 432 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate rain in the advisory area. Urban and small stream flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond, Downtown Richmond, Virginia Commonwealth University, Virginia Union University, University Of Richmond, Bon Air, Tuckahoe, Highland Springs, Mechanicsville, Lakeside, East Highland Park, Bensley, Laurel, Glen Allen, Bellwood, Greendale, Dumbarton, Montrose, Chamberlayne and Richmond Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico
